summary: The Comparison of Sustainable Transportation Act (COST Act) mandates an analysis of the costs associated with converting the federal light-duty vehicle fleet from gasoline to electric and flex-fuel ethanol vehicles. The bill requires the Comptroller General to conduct cost analyses, including infrastructure needs, and publish them online.  Additionally, it directs the Secretary of Energy to conduct a lifecycle analysis of greenhouse gas emissions from gasoline, E85 flex-fuel, and electric vehicles, reporting findings to relevant congressional committees.
